page.title: 12EDUCATION
page.content: Our Infant {school}is very old. It was first built in 1884. It was an old British Board School. It was founded so that each child "should be given the best secular education that the fund of the school may admit." When the school started there were 50 children on the registars. If there was a fair day, or during harvest time these numbers would drop to 2 or 3 as in those days children did not have to attend school compulsarily as we do now.There are 134 children in the school at present divided into 4 classes. There are 37 reception children,46 middle infants and 51 top infants. In the playground there are three tiples (climbing frames). When the children's teacher is on playground duty the children in that class can play on them for that playtime.
